Massachusetts sex offender charged in assault on boy in New Hampshire

A Level 3 sex offender from Haverhill pleaded not guilty to accusations that he assaulted a boy, 9, on Sunday at a Walmart in Plaistow, N.H., police said. (1:07 p.m.)

Mass. urges taxpayers
to file returns online

With only 6 percent of users filing with paper forms, officials are trying for hefty savings by prodding everyone to file electronically.

The soul of the church

Local priests like Jim Scahill, John Unni, Jack Ahern, and Doc Conway would never be considered papal candidates. But they walk in Jesus’s footsteps.

Prepping for the casino economy

Students in the inaugural class of the New England Casino Dealer Academy are hoping to capitalize on the emerging Massachusetts casino industry.
Opinion | Farah Stockman

The politics of oil in Venezuela

The country’s oil reserves, and the American desire to keep the oil flowing, have defined the Venezuelan government’s relationship with its people, and the US.

ACLU privacy project funded

Two luminaries of the Boston tech community have contributed $1 million to launch an initiative at the ACLU of Massachusetts meant to safeguard privacy.
Opinion | Tom Keane

The difficulty with snow days

When closing schools because of snow, officials must err on the side of safety.

Web health records firm grows

Miami start-up CareCloud Corp. will formally open a Boston office Tuesday in a refurbished brick factory in the Innovation ­District.

Study: Ancient mummies
had clogged arteries

Even without modern-day temptations like fast food or cigarettes, people had clogged arteries some 4,000 years ago, according to the biggest-ever hunt for the condition in mummies.
